intro: Mentzelia laevicaulis, commonly known as the smoothstem blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its tall, branching stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has smooth, hairless leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Mentzelia laevicaulis is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
